list_definition.definition: a small house, especially one at a gate to the grounds of a large house.
a room at a college gate etc for an attendant
to live in rooms for which one pays, in someone else’s house

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The bullet was lodged in his spine.

list_definition.definition: to make (an objection, an appeal etc) formally or officially

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She is lodging an official complaint.
